question: The "Bab Iskender Strait" separates which two countries?
explanation: Bab Iskender Strait, also known as the Eastern Strait or the small strait or the narrow strait, is a strait which separates Arabian Peninsula of Yemen from Ras Siyyan Peninsula of Djibouti, located in the Horn of Africa. It forms the eastern part of the Bab-el-Mandeb Straits. It lies adjacent to Seven Brothers Islands of Djibouti.
